Html:
We've been using PHPExcel very successfully to read excel5 workbooks. With the latest PHPExcel version (1.7.0 and svn head) we're now getting 'Unrecognized token 2D in formula' errors when trying to open workbooks which open fine with the earlier version.

A sample problem workbook is at: http://www.box.net/shared/pbyp4rdzk6

- Chris

Ok, thanks, I see the problem. Your Excel workbook is using so-called shared formulas. This was not supported by Excel5 reader in PHPExcel 1.6.7. There it was only reading the calculated value instead of the formulas. Excel5 reader is supposed to support shared formulas in PHPExcel 1.7.0, but you have apparently found a bug. I will see if I can fix this tomorrow. Will post back here.

Fixed:

http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=10615

Look at patch at that link, or just wait for source code release tomorrow, and download from here:

http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/SourceControl/ListDownloadableCommits.aspx

Brilliant koyama! I'll grab it and test over the weekend.

Thanks,

Chris

Hi,
how about "2B unrecognized token in formula"? Could you release a patch also?

Thanks,
Tom
